sources.title: Wolves of the Range
sources.description: Title: Wolves of the Range Summary: Dorn is after the rancher's land and is trying to stop Banker Brady from helping them. When his man Hammond kills Brady, there is a run on the bank. When Rocky volunteers to ride to the ... Directed by: Sam Newfield Actors: Robert Livingston, Al St. John, Frances Gladwin Production Company: Sigmund Neufeld Productions Release Date: 21 June 1943 (USA) Aspect Ratio: 1.37 : 1 Dorn is after the rancher's land and is trying to stop Banker Brady from helping them. When his man Hammond kills Brady, there is a run on the bank. When Rocky volunteers to ride to the next town for money, he is ambushed by Dorn's men, loses his memory, and is jailed for supposedly stealing the money.

sources.title: Wolves of the Range
sources.description: Dorn (I. Stanford Jolley) is after the rancher's land and is trying to stop Banker Brady (Ed Cassidy) from helping them. When his man Hammond (Jack Ingram) kills Brady, there is a run on the bank. When Rocky (Robert Livingston) volunteers to ride to the next town for money, he is ambushed by Dorn's men, loses his memory, and is jailed for supposedly stealing the money.

sources.title: Wolves of the Range (1943) THE LONE RIDER
sources.description:
Stars: Robert Livingston, Al St. John, Frances Gladwin 
 Director: Sam Newfield

 Dorn is after the rancher's land and is trying to stop Banker Brady from helping them. When his man Hammond kills Brady, there is a run on the bank. When Rocky volunteers to ride to the next town for money, he is ambushed by Dorn's men, loses his memory, and is jailed for supposedly stealing the money.

metadata.Plot: Dorn is after the rancher's land and is trying to stop Banker Brady from helping them. When his man Hammond kills Brady, there is a run on the bank. When Rocky volunteers to ride to the next town for money, he is ambushed by Dorn's men, loses his memory, and is jailed for supposedly stealing the money.
